game

Class FancyPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
      • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Player
        • game.FancyPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Printable, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Skilled, Comparable<edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor>

    public class FancyPlayer
extends edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Player
    Upgraded version of stock player class in engine, supports certain necessary features Including ninja stuns, water gun operation, oxygen tank renewals
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Rithesh Jayaram , Sarah Dennis

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      FancyPlayer(String name, char displayChar, int priority, int hitPoints, List<edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap> maps)
      Instantiate a FancyPlayer, an upgraded version of player Constructor is almost unmodified, but also takes a list of maps during init

    • Constructor Detail

      • FancyPlayer

        public FancyPlayer(String name,
                   char displayChar,
                   int priority,
                   int hitPoints,
                   List<edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap> maps)
        Instantiate a FancyPlayer, an upgraded version of player Constructor is almost unmodified, but also takes a list of maps during init
        Parameters:
        name - Name of player
        displayChar - Char that represents player on map
        priority - Execution priotity of player - should ideally be as high as possible
        hitPoints - Amount of hitpoints player begins with
        maps - List of maps contained in world - used when player needs to teleport to one

        Stuns player for 2 turns, if not already stunned

        Adds 10 points / turns worth of oxygen to player's oxygen counter

      • movePlayerToMap

        public void movePlayerToMap(String mapName)
        Moves player from their current map to the map specified Also sets / unsets the 'isPlayerOnMoon' flag on movement
        Parameters:
